result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shikerra Zhane Lockett

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shikerra Zhane Lockett appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Shikerra Zhane Lockett.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel discovery and offer and requests plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shikerra Zhane Lockett appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Shikerra Zhane Lockett.  Attorney Josh Milder in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel has discovery but needs an offer from the State and requests a pre-trial conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shikerra Zhane Lockett appeared by video.  Attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Tom Harris as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate to be determined at the conclusion of the case until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shikerra Zhane Lockett in court. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for indigency hearing. Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case to allow defendant to retain private counsel. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with DJWJ (5/4/95),; JMB (7/15/96),;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shikerra Zhane Lockett in court with Student Intern Meghan DeVol under the supervision of attorney Colleen A Taylor. Defendant Shikerra Zhane Lockett in custody.  Nate K. McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shikerra Zhane Lockett appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT. 
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
